column1: I wanted to take a quick moment to remind you of the latest guidance and guidelines from the CDC and VDH on what you can do to limit the spread of the Coronavirus protect your family and friends and ensure we all get through the holidays safely.  More: https://t.co/Hw1LNnS7n0
Proud to honor the public health workforce this year for their tremendous efforts in combating the COVID-19 virus and keeping our loved ones healthy. https://t.co/LM3VbUg8Lh

Thank you to our nation's healthcare workers who have gone above and beyond this year as we have faced the COVID-19 pandemic. You are often the first line of defense for our rural communities and for your service we say thank you. https://t.co/1Pc9S40HvY

Last week I had the opportunity to tour the @FXBGNats Park. FredNats have done a great job to provide opportunities for safe fun activities at the park in light of COVID. Life will again return to normal and when it does baseball will still be here to help bring us together. https://t.co/Hthn6hvFCD

Kathryn and I are praying for a speedy recovery for Governor and First Lady Northam and their staff as they deal with the effects of COVID-19. As a reminder to all: wash your hands practice social distancing and wear a mask indoors. @GovernorVA  https://t.co/0gvTJe0WBM

Last week I sent a letter to @SpeakerPelosi urging bipartisan action to achieve real results for the American people suffering most from the effects of COVID-19. Unfortunately real results have been stymied by partisan politics. Read more: https://t.co/IBf0iwbYEG https://t.co/tScryFmOH8

During COVID-19 employment opportunities may be hard to find so I want to provide you with important resources from the VEC. The road to economic recovery may be long but there are tools available to help: https://t.co/6nn4bVdCTx

Since the start of the pandemic I have promised to keep you informed and fight for you. That's why I sent over 125 emails Mar-Jul with resources and info and that's why I make this commitment today: I am working to restore rebuild and renew our nation in the wake of COVID-19. https://t.co/SdSCfErMce

(2/3) The COVID-19 pandemic has only exacerbated the need to high-speed broadband & has pushed the importance of telehealth capabilities to the forefront. This chat was intended to hear directly from local government leaders tribal leader and VA broadband stakeholders.

(1/2) I have advocated for greater telehealth services for patients especially seniors and those in rural areas for years but due to COVID-19 we have seen the increased need for these services to limit the spread of COVID-19 and to lower the risk for those most vulnerable. https://t.co/kL6grqgQYi

(2/3)  -> Urged HHS to provide increased emergency relief funding to all long-term care facilities including assisted living communities.  -> Visited the VCU Health System to learn more about VCU’s independently developed COVID-19 test for inpatients.

(1/3)  During COVID-19 I am working for you here are a few of my actions on finding vital healthcare solutions:   -> Supported the CARES Act which expanded telehealth services by opening up expanded telehealth services in the Medicare program

Had the pleasure of talking with @fxbgchamber today about the economic impact of COVID-19 and the implications of Chinese trade relations with our nation state and region. On the road to recovery I am working for you to ensure that we are set up for success long-term. https://t.co/g2JsJamo87

ICYMI: The Commonwealth has announced a $70M grant program for small businesses and nonprofit organizations whose normal operations were disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic. More here: https://t.co/NvFzdGTjt5

(1/2) Working for you: Earlier this week I stopped by several locations in the #Woodbridge and #Manassas areas to safely visit with hardworking Americans who are helping our region as we work to recovery from the economic impacts of COVID-19. https://t.co/1TPtI5hEtx

ALERT: @POTUS is expanding access to telehealth services to ensure rural Americans have access to vital healthcare services during the COVID-19 pandemic. I am glad to see this EO designed to echo work I am doing to close the #digitaldivide. More here: https://t.co/A1TVXDV3L8

Did you miss my call? I have had nearly a dozen public telephone town halls throughout the COVID-19 pandemic to safely provide you with the most up-to-date information you need to know! Click here to sign up for my next one: https://t.co/RKaBw3Vj5J https://t.co/MRz9W2E0zH

ALERT: @HHSGov recently announced that they will begin providing nursing homes with a Point of Care rapid response testing instrument to help prevent the spread of COVID-19. More information here: https://t.co/kKsG9iw95m

Bringing broadband service to the unserved in our area is one of my top priorities especially through the COVID-19 pandemic. I am proud to work with King George and other localities to close the #digitaldivide. https://t.co/BOz1P5IQ3r

I sent a letter to Speaker Pelosi urging that Congress give up our August vacation until we complete critical legislative items especially in light of the economic impacts of COVID-19. Read my full letter here: https://t.co/cjC1nxJA7v https://t.co/qOxnNrYz7R

Congress’s job is to listen. During the COVID-19 crisis I have had more than 30000 inbound contacts from folks across our region including phone calls emails and socially distanced face-to-face interactions. Let me know what issues matter most to you: https://t.co/eJM2BVdK5E https://t.co/kmtd8A5BoL

As we recover from the economic impacts of COVID-19 we must ensure folks have access to resources they need to stay connected.  I introduced a bill with @RepSpanberger to cut down on govt waste and provide refurbished computers to those who need them most. https://t.co/g9H8WbPKnH

Great news: The first COVID-19 #vaccine tested in the US revved up people’s immune systems just the way scientists had hoped -- as the shots are poised to begin key final testing. I agree with Dr. Fauci: “No matter how you slice this this is good news." https://t.co/1AKaZcS2mD

(2/3) This pandemic has focused significant attention on the vital role of public health officials who have served and sacrificed on the front lines in the fight against the COVID-19. Now more than ever it's important to highlight the dedication of public health professionals.

(1/3) As co-chair of the Congressional Public Health Caucus this week I co-introduced a resolution to recognize National Public Health Week 2020 to acknowledge the incredible work of our nation’s public health workers through the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

(2/5) This letter follows another letter I sent on Friday to House and Senate leadership requesting they prioritize the delivery of broadband services to rural communities most impacted by the effects of the Coronavirus in future relief bills.
UPDATE: Rite Aid continues to open more COVID-19 testing sites across our region. Click here to learn more about the impact locally: https://t.co/BUHsj19mAA

I will continue to work with officials at all levels of government as we work to get Virginia back on the road to recovery from the health and economic impacts of COVID-19. There is still much to be done but I am committed to fighting for Virginians to achieve real results.

(2/3) The Coronavirus pandemic has emphasized the need for high-speed broadband to rural America. The purpose of this virtual Fireside Chat was to hear directly and inform local government leaders tribal leaders and key Virginia broadband stakeholders.

(1/3) Today I hosted a virtual Fireside Chat with @AjitPaiFCC to discuss @FCC's work on rural broadband buildout the Rural Digital Opportunity Fund (RDOF) and what the FCC is doing during to help communities during the Coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/RxjQCAjPxo

(1/2) I called on top officials to support the National Guard last week and I am very glad to see DoD reverse their initial decision and keep our NG troops serving our communities on the front lines in the fight against COVID-19. https://t.co/SNAEgLHo1E

(3/3) I will continue to lead our Commonwealth as we navigate the federal state and local response to the health and economic impacts to the Coronavirus. We must continue to practice social distancing to keep our nation and communities safe.

(1/3) Our nation has passed a somber milestone. This sobering report makes it clear that our nation is still on the road to recovery and that we must continue to follow safe practices and CDC guidelines to prevent the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/EQdgKPdI9o

ALERT: @GovernorVA issued guidance requiring face coverings in public indoor settings to help contain the spread COVID-19. He also directed Dept of Labor and Industry to develop emergency standards to prevent workplace exposure to COVID-19. More info here: https://t.co/3PoDXhXQDm

(4/4) We must ensure that our servicemembers on the front lines in the fight against COVID-19 are taken care of and get the benefits they have earned and deserve. As a leader in supporting our warfighters I will continue to stand with those who are protecting our nation.

(2/4) Our letter signals strong support for the Natl Guard and the work they are doing in support of the COVID-19 pandemic. It requests the federal status of the Natl Guard be based on solely on need and not auxiliary factors.

(1/4) I joined my colleagues from both the House and Senate in sending a letter to the President Secretary of Defense and FEMA Administrator regarding impacts to the National Guard arising from their COVID-19 related deployment across the country.

(1/4) As millions of Virginians face uncertainty I stand ready to help folks who need assistance the most. Throughout the pandemic response I have participated in several food distribution events throughout #VA01 bringing needed food and supplies to those affected by COVID-19. https://t.co/OtXkeh5Khq

Due to COVID-19 in-person tours of the US Capitol are on hold. However the CVC has created a Capitol tour video that is now available. This video enables people to “visit the Capitol” during this time when we are unable to offer in-person tours: https://t.co/CFWOOM85eT

ATTN PWC RESIDENTS: Check out this list of Coronavirus Testing Sites in Prince William County for folks in that area who need access to testing capabilities. Thank you to @pwcgov for this important resource. https://t.co/NNVL8ZpUBV

(2/3) In March I made a personal call to @VP and his team then heading up COVID response to advocate for @VCU's partnership. As a former public health official and co-chair of the Public Health Caucus I know the importance of leadership on projects that will do the most good.

While many folks are home in order to prevent the spread of COVID-19 our nation’s law enforcement officers remain on the front lines keeping our communities safe and operational. This National Police Week we say a very special thank you. #NationalPoliceWeek2020 https://t.co/1vL5M8beAF

Today we recognize the work of all members of our nation's armed forces on #ArmedForcesDay. Right now we are fighting a new foe #COVID19 and our service members have answered the call from NYC to Seattle to right here in Va. Thank you for your service to a grateful nation. https://t.co/347JV13xFN

(1/4) I just voted against an 1800+ page $3T partisan wish list pieced together exclusively by House Democrats. The main provisions of this misguided bill predate the pandemic and are not targeted at fighting COVID-19. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/mDwyvgvbmt

(1/6) Throughout the health and economic response to the Coronavirus in Virginia I have been a leader on several key issues that affect hardworking Virginians as well as address the effects of COVID-19.

(1/3) ALERT: @Walmart is working with eTrueNorth as well as state and local officials to open a drive-thru COVID-19 testing site at Store #1825 in Manassas VA. The site will be open to any adult who meets the CDC and state and local guidelines on who should be tested.

(1/3) Today we will be voting on leg released by @SpeakerPelosi earlier this week; it was drafted behind closed doors is more than 1800 pages and costs over $3 trillion. The main provisions of this misguided bill predate the pandemic and are not targeted at fighting COVID-19.

(4/5)  ✅ Protected seniors and healthcare workers through requests for greater funds for nursing homes ✅ Provided vital updates and information for people economically impacted by COVID-19 including unemployment guidance and FAQs
(2/2) That is why I sent this letter to HHS demanding increased resources to nursing homes. We must do more for the most vulnerable in this fight against #Coronavirus. https://t.co/KfYQMWGDzu

(2/4) The main demands of the next package--changing election laws bailing out mismanaged pensions and temporarily suspending cap on SALT tax deductions for millionaires and billionaires--were drafted behind closed doors predate the crisis and are not targeted to coronavirus.

(1/4) @SpeakerPelosi has unveiled her plan for the next phase of economic recovery from the Coronavirus but unfortunately it's just a Dem messaging bill with no hopes of passing the Senate. Americans deserve a govt focused on defeating this virus and getting folks back to work.

(4/4) I urge action on this issue & will continue to call on leadership to help Va in the ongoing COVID-19 response. I will continue to be a leader in Va on getting our region operational again at the right time and ensure the health of Va. My letter here: https://t.co/r1drOLJIRO

(1/4) As part of my continued efforts to lead Va’s Coronavirus response at the federal level I sent a letter to Congressional leadership demanding action on an issue that affects hundreds of thousands of Virginians along the Peninsula and Hampton Roads. https://t.co/r1drOLJIRO
(1/2) This week is #NationalPoliceWeek and there is no better time to recognize the incredible work done by law enforcement officials during the ongoing response to COVID-19. https://t.co/7nq3P3HwFO

This is the brand new Virginia "LOVE" sign here in Fredericksburg sending love to the healthcare workers first responders and all those on the front lines in the fight against COVID-19. #VirginiaIsForLovers https://t.co/royIowQSNB

(1/3) ALERT: @VCU Health’s Emergency Center at New Kent will open its doors for patient care on June 1. Originally set to open in spring 2020 the opening of the facility was postponed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/id9LOP3ZaQ

This week is #PSRW and no time could be more fitting to thank public servants as they fight against the COVID19. Public servants have gone above and beyond in their work to keep our communities safe healthy and operational during these difficult times and for that thank you. https://t.co/elWVSq3fqX

Thank you to Homeland Security Investigations – who has continued to protect us from fraud as we fight the #COVID19 pandemic. They have partnered with the private sector to stop fraud schemes and counterfeit materials from entering the US supply chain. https://t.co/kh8Y572WJO

Today our nation says #ThankYouNurses on this #NationalNursesDay. Now more than ever we have seen the remarkable work of the men and women who every day serve our communities on the front lines in the fight against COVID-19. We can never say thank you enough for the work you do. https://t.co/1Jpprbm90i

ALERT: @GovernorVA extended the state’s business shutdown until 5/14 but expects to begin rolling back restrictions after that shifting to the next phase in the fight against COVID-19 in Va. More here: https://t.co/gnKmXSsMJg

(2/5) As our nation fights this COVID-19 pandemic our federal workers have continued to effect positive change in every community and in every state across the country. I want to extend my deepest gratitude to the men and women who consider public service a calling.

(2/2) I introduced the #ServingRuralAmerica Act to bring service to the underserved during the #COVID19 pandemic and I continue to call on my colleagues to include this measure in the next phase of relief for Americans.  https://t.co/N1zboRoa1y

(1/3) During these trying times I want to highlight work of area businesses who are going above and beyond in service to our community. La Tienda under owner Chef Greg Mincher in Wmbg has joined forces with World Central Kitchen to help feed locals affected by COVID-19 crisis.

(2/2) There are over 800 confirmed cases of COVID-19 on the USS Theodore Roosevelt. In these uncertain times we must maintain a strong fighting force and that starts with prioritizing the health of our warfighters. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/bdTpT0e9wh

(1/2) As @DeptofDefense moves forward with a deeper review of events surrounding the #COVID19 outbreak aboard USS Theodore Roosevelt we cannot lose sight of the current health of our sailors and what they continue to need as we respond to this pandemic.

(2/2) Whether you are a small biz owner an employee or recently unemployed there are ways to get help. Watch this quick video with information on how the Coronavirus affects you and what resources are available to get you through these difficult times: https://t.co/5tDXMKPaXL

(1/2) The federal government has acted to provide emergency relief for all Americans affected by the Coronavirus pandemic. I was proud to support legislation getting help to folks who need it most in this unprecedented chapter of our nation’s history. https://t.co/MKEmSd4X7p

(3/4) In addition to the food included in the bags was health information with important phone numbers and a word of encouragement. Right now the fight against COVID-19 will be won by communities by neighbors and by information. https://t.co/EJPeAZ0UoR

(2/4) We started our morning with a prayer and began to pack bags of food to take to those who are unable to or should not be out of the house in order to stop the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/7H2i9pYsbo
ICYMI: On Thursday I supported the PPP/HCE Act because it is critical to our continued recovery as a nation to the COVID-19 pandemic.

I am so proud to have supported this important measure to help folks in our region. It is my hope that for the next phase we can come together early and in a bipartisan manner to assist the people affected most by #COVID19. https://t.co/HY9Qq4yxo9
Today I supported the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act because it is critical to our continued recovery as a nation to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Even during these difficult times the incredible folks at #HSI continue to work to combat COVID-19 related fraud and other criminal activity. Thank you for what you do! https://t.co/LY8PihYos2

Here we are 1 wk later – and we have not yet passed the funding we need to replenish the #PaycheckProtectionProgram. We cannot delay when it comes to getting support to small biz affected by #COVID19. America cannot afford to wait any longer. I am working to get this done now. https://t.co/CH0L6fTrNY

(2/3) This week @GovernorVA announced a statewide effort to recruit an additional 30000 volunteers for the #MRC. The MRC is made up of teams of health professionals and community members working to assist our healthcare workers in the fight against #COVIDー19.

ALERT: @FCC’s #COVID19 Telehealth Program application portal is now OPEN. This program will provide $200M to support healthcare providers responding to the pandemic by fully funding their telecomms services IT services and devices. More here: https://t.co/4igp8HSYW1

Over $71B has been disbursed from the $350B #PaycheckProtectionProgram in less than 1 wk. Applications continue to pour in from small biz across the US. We need to replenish the account. I will continue to work to pass a measure getting resources to those affected by COVID-19.

This will help provide connectivity to many homes schools libraries & small businesses - connecting them to the 21st century economy. I am encouraged by the cooperation of so many Virginia partners to make this a reality during this COVID-19 crisis.

Just last week I intro-ed the Serving Rural America Act #SRAA to create a pilot grant program at @FCC authorizing $500M over 5 yrs to expand service to unserved areas. As we move forward with legislation to combat the coronavirus crisis we cannot leave rural America behind.

MY LATEST in the Richmond Times Dispatch today: The current COVID-19 crisis that our nation is facing has highlighted the great digital divide that impacts folks in rural areas.  https://t.co/N1zboRoa1y
(4/6) @RedCross has an ongoing critical need for blood and platelet donations amidst coronavirus uncertainties. You can make an appointment to give blood or platelets here: https://t.co/8lY9fFoMsP

(2/6) .@RedCross is closely monitoring the outbreak of COVID-19 and is working constantly to carry out their lifesaving mission as well as supporting public health agencies to help communities prepare.

(1/6) Since the beginning of the #COVID19 outbreak I have heard from countless constituents asking how they can give back to their community during this time of need for our nation. One way you can get involved is if you are eligible donating blood to @RedCross.
ICYMI: @CDCgov has issued new guidance on the use of face coverings to combat the spread of #COVID19. “CDC is advising the use of face coverings to #slowthespread.” More here: https://t.co/TEIUrA5By4

This is #PublicHealthWeek and I want to recognize the great work being done by healthcare professionals especially those in nursing homes during these times. Thank you for all you do. I'll continue to support you to ensure you are well-equipped in this fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/VKsN1M9BVF

On this #WorldHealthDay I wanted to send a huge “thank you” to the incredible healthcare workers who are on the front lines against #COVID19. I will continue to support you in Congress to ensure you are well-equipped in this fight. https://t.co/qZqZ5vhmPn

(2/2) If your org has repurposed a facility to assist in the COVID-19 response or has gone above and beyond in service to our community you can email their story to: VA01SuccessStories@mail.house.gov. Together we will come through these times stronger than ever.
Together we will come through this time stronger than ever. To ensure you never miss my latest alerts on our ongoing response to #COVID19 sign up for my newsletter here: https://t.co/eJM2BVdK5E

To every doctor who has worked tirelessly during this #COVID19 outbreak thank you. Each day you are giving your all to keep Americans healthy and safe. Our nation is grateful to you. We are also grateful to all our healthcare workers during these times. #NationalDoctorsDay https://t.co/ChFjBV7VJv

It is important to note that we must implement strategies such as social distancing to #FlattentheCurve and reduce the spread of #Coronavirus in our country. #SocialDistancing is not just fist-bumps but measures to prevent coming in contact with those that could have the virus. https://t.co/XOlvhypBbS

I applaud the leadership of @AjitPaiFCC. As more people turn to the internet to learn work and receive telehealth we must ensure that Americans don't lose broadband or telephone connectivity as a result of #COVID19. #KeepAmericansConnected https://t.co/lgNVBl4AwS
Today on this special #NationalDayofPrayer I am praying for all those throughout our nation and the world suffering from the #Coronavirus outbreak.

UPDATE: As of Sunday morning 45 people in Virginia tested positive for COVID-19. Our main goal is containment. We must reduce the strain on our healthcare system and slow the rate of infection so our health system maintains capacity to deal with the most serious cases.
